section.section: A Maryland railroad company may cross or divert an unnavigable stream whenever it is necessary to construct a railroad.
A Maryland railroad company that diverts a stream is liable for damage caused by the diversion.

text.section:
A Maryland railroad company may cross a canal or a navigable stream if the company:
submits to the Board of Public Works a plan for the canal or stream crossing that includes the location and building plans of the bridge and other necessary fixtures; and
receives written approval from the Board of Public Works.

section.section: If the Board of Public Works disapproves a plan submitted by a Maryland railroad company or fails to approve the plan within 20 days after filing, the Maryland railroad company may apply to the circuit court of the county where the canal or stream crossing is planned or to another court of competent jurisdiction.
An order by the court approving the plan and conditions for the canal or stream crossing shall be sufficient authority for the Maryland railroad company to elect, use, and occupy the bridge.
